page.title: 05TYPES OF HOUSING IN BLOCK
page.content: The only concentration of population in this block is in the village of Longburton (population 300) the remainder of the area being dotted with farms consisting often of the farmhouse and several farm cottages. In Longburton which has developed along the A352 road there are two large farms (Manor Farm and Long Burton Farm) and many of the houses in the village are occupied by people engaged in agricultural work. In the l950s a small Council development of 6 houses were built - four of these have now been sold. In the l970s two private developments were built with 30 houses in the biggest. These houses are built of reconstituted stone with tiled roofs. Several houses in the area have thatched roofs.
